paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper investigates the association between the BRCA2 N372H variant and male breast cancer risk, providing insights into penetrance data and genotype frequencies.

patients.demographics: male, mean age at interview 67.9 years

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A strongly increased MBC risk (OR = 5.63; 95%CI = 1.70; 18.61) in younger subjects with the HH homozygous genotype.
A strongly increased MBC risk (OR = 5.63; 95%CI = 1.70; 18.61) in younger subjects with the HH homozygous genotype.
No statistically significant difference in the distribution of the three specific BRCA2 N372H genotypes was observed between MBC cases and controls.
No statistically significant difference in the distribution of the three specific BRCA2 N372H genotypes was observed between MBC cases and controls.

functional_data.summary: The N372H variant is a common polymorphism in BRCA2 that may affect protein function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families, particularly in younger males.
variants.population_frequency: The N372H variant has a rare allele frequency greater than 10%.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on case-control studies.
variants.additional_notes: The study suggests a potential interaction between the N372H genotype and age in relation to MBC risk.
key_quotes: Overall, our findings, although based on a relatively small series, suggest that the BRCA2 HH homozygous genotype might be positively associated with an increased risk of MBC in men younger than 60 years.
A statistically significant interaction emerged between this genotype and age (p = 0.032).

tables_processed.table_caption: Distribution of 91 MBC cases not mutated in BRCA genes and 261 male population controls according to the BRCA2 N372H genotype frequencies.

Odds Ratios (OR) and 95% Confidence Intervals according to a co-dominant model, estimated by a logistic regression model after adjustment for age considered as a dichotomous variable (<60 years, >60 years).

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear data on the BRCA2 N372H variant.
